title: Authors and Citation
text: Hamish Gamble. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Gamble H (2025). reportabs: Makes Reporting ABS Time Series Data Simpler. R package version 0.0.3, https://f-fof.github.io/reportabs/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {reportabs: Makes Reporting ABS Time Series Data Simpler},   author = {Hamish Gamble},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.0.3},   url = {https://f-fof.github.io/reportabs/}, }

what: Makes Reporting ABS Time Series Data Simpler
title: Makes Reporting ABS Time Series Data Simpler
text: reportabs package designed make reporting ABS data easier. designed work (!) data included aitidata package. reportabs contains functions help visual textual reporting data.

title: Makes Reporting ABS Time Series Data Simpler
text: reportabs can installed github : package works ABS Time Series data. collection pre-tidied ABS data available aitidata package. package large constantly updated, shouldn’t need install . Instead, can access data package. also recommended tidyverse installed loaded.

title: Makes Reporting ABS Time Series Data Simpler
text: package designed : report changes labour market (data) indicators; plot labour market (data) indicators time; generate monthly labour force briefing

title: Makes Reporting ABS Time Series Data Simpler
text: following functions can assist reporting ABS time series data: current(): Report current value indicator. growth(): Report growth indicator specified period. change(): Report change level indicator specified period. last_value(): Report value indicator previous year month. value_at(): Report value indicator specific year month. average_over(): Report average value indicator specified period. release(): Report recent year month data. key functions argument filter_with. argument takes list parameters must specified generate correct data. filter_with requires specify least indicator list(indicator = " "). available indicators dataset can viewed distinct() dplyr package example distinct(labour_force, indicator). filter_with can used also filter gender, state/territory (including Australia), age group, industry, series type.

what: Generate a time-series plot for ABS labour force indicators. — abs_plot
title: Generate a time-series plot for ABS labour force indicators. — abs_plot
text: abs_plot() can automatically generate appropriate plots ABS Time Series indicators static display documents, RMarkdown, well interactive plots plotly.

title: Generate a time-series plot for ABS labour force indicators. — abs_plot
code: abs_plot(   data = NULL,   filter_with,   over = deprecated(),   years = 2015,   compare_aus = TRUE,   markdown = FALSE,   facet = NULL,   plotly = FALSE,   void = FALSE,   ... )

title: Generate a time-series plot for ABS labour force indicators. — abs_plot
text: data (optional). Specify data frame tibble object use data labour_force data included aitidata package. can use pipe operator. filter_with named list specifying plot. longer supported. Please use filter_with instead. years numeric. compare_aus (optional) logical. Defaults TRUE adds Australian data selected indicators. markdown (optional) logical. Defaults FALSE. Specify TRUE want use markdown elements title/subtitle/axis titles facet (optional) string. Defaults NULL. Specify variable facet graph . plotly (optional) logical. Defaults FALSE creates ggplot2 plot. Select TRUE create plotly plot. Note aspects plot unavailable plotly = TRUE, including subtitles, captions. void (optional) logical. Defaults FALSE. Specify TRUE remove plot elements except line. ... arguments passed theme_fof()

title: Generate a time-series plot for ABS labour force indicators. — abs_plot
text: ggplot2 time-series plot plotly time-series plot plotly = TRUE

what: The average of an indicator between two years — average_over
title: The average of an indicator between two years — average_over
text: average indicator two years

title: The average of an indicator between two years — average_over
The average of an indicator between two years — average_over
text: data data frame cleaned ABS Time Series data returned readabs filter_with list variables filter data frame . Must include indicator date range c(min, max) calculate average

title: The average of an indicator between two years — average_over
text: numeric

title: The average of an indicator between two years — average_over
code: library(reportabs) labour_force_briefing <- read_absdata("labour_force_briefing") average_over(labour_force_briefing, list(indicator = "Employed total"), between = c(2010,2015)) #> [1] NaN

what: Create a string describing whether an indicator has increased or decreased over the year, or over the previous month — change
title: Create a string describing whether an indicator has increased or decreased over the year, or over the previous month — change
text: Create string describing whether indicator increased decreased year, previous month

title: Create a string describing whether an indicator has increased or decreased over the year, or over the previous month — change
code: change(   data,   filter_with,   type = "id",   ym = "year",   at_year = NULL,   at_month = NULL )

title: Create a string describing whether an indicator has increased or decreased over the year, or over the previous month — change
text: data dataframe cleaned ABS Time Series data returned readabs::read_abs() filter_with list variables filter dataframe. type controls wording text. Options 'id' increased decreased, "ab" , "rf" risen fallen "present" increase decrease. ym ym = "year" calculate change year, ym = "month" calculate change month at_year default, change() returns difference past 12 months (current year). at_year at_month can specified calculate change current value, value at_year at_month. at_month default, change() returns difference past 12 months (current year). at_year at_month can specified calculate change current value, value at_year at_month.

title: Create a string describing whether an indicator has increased or decreased over the year, or over the previous month — change
text: character

title: Create a string describing whether an indicator has increased or decreased over the year, or over the previous month — change
code: library(reportabs) labour_force_briefing <- read_absdata("labour_force_briefing") #> Reading labour_force_briefing file found in /tmp/RtmpvDV5w1 change(labour_force_briefing, filter_with = list(indicator = "Employed total", series_type = "Seasonally Adjusted")) #> [1] "increased by 308,036 (2.1%) to 14.54 million"

Indicator must specified ym ym = "year" calculate change year, ym = "month" calculate change month at_year default, change() returns difference past 12 months (current year). at_year at_month can specified calculate change current value, value at_year at_month. at_month default, change() returns difference past 12 months (current year). at_year at_month can specified calculate change current value, value at_year at_month.

text: data dataframe cleaned ABS Time Series data returned readabs filter_with list variables filter dataframe . Valid variables include gender, age, indicator, series type. ym one "year", "quarter", "month"  return value time last year (default), quarter, month. print logical pass numeric as_comma as_percent printing. Defaults TRUE

what: reportabs: Makes Reporting ABS Time Series Data Simpler — reportabs-package
title: reportabs: Makes Reporting ABS Time Series Data Simpler — reportabs-package
text: Makes reporting ABS TimeSeries data simpler. provides convenience functions plotting labour market indicators, reporting changes indicators time. Links aitidata package.

title: reportabs: Makes Reporting ABS Time Series Data Simpler — reportabs-package
text: Maintainer: Hamish Gamble hamish.gamble@flinders.edu.au

what: Plot the Sahm Recession Indicator for a given state. The Sahm indicator compares the 3 month average (seasonally adjusted) unemployment rate with the minimum over the last 12 months. Sahm values over 1 are indicative of a recession. — sahm
title: Plot the Sahm Recession Indicator for a given state. The Sahm indicator compares the 3 month average (seasonally adjusted) unemployment rate with the minimum over the last 12 months. Sahm values over 1 are indicative of a recession. — sahm

title: AITI Theme — theme_aiti
text: base_size base size text elements plot. (default 12) colour background colour plot. legend position legend (default legend) markdown Whether use markdown formatting plot titles (default FALSE) flipped TRUE flip y-axis guide lines show x-axis instead. legacy Whether use legacy fonts

text: ggplot2 theme

what: ggplot2 theme for Factory of the Future — theme_fof
title: ggplot2 theme for Factory of the Future — theme_fof
text: Theme plots publications, reports, Shiny apps, etc. Anywhere ggplot2 used, can use theme!

title: ggplot2 theme for Factory of the Future — theme_fof
code: theme_fof(   base_size = 12,   colour = "Sand",   legend = "none",   markdown = FALSE,   flipped = FALSE,   legacy = FALSE )

title: ggplot2 theme for Factory of the Future — theme_fof
text: base_size base size text elements plot. (default 12) colour background colour plot. Background colours applied 80% transparency. (default 'Soft Black') legend position legend. (default "none") markdown Whether use markdown formatting plot titles (default FALSE) flipped Whether flip y-axis guide lines show x-axis instead (default FALSE) legacy Whether use legacy (AITI) fonts. option removed sometime future.

title: ggplot2 theme for Factory of the Future — theme_fof
text: ggplo2 theme

title: ggplot2 theme for Factory of the Future — theme_fof
code: library(ggplot2) df <- data.frame(x = c("One", "Two", "Three"), y = c(4, 2, 9)) p <- ggplot(df, aes(x = x, y = y, fill = x)) + geom_col() p + theme_fof()

title: Foundation Theme — theme_foundation
text: theme designed foundation build new themes, meant used directly. theme_foundation() complete theme minimal number elements defined. easier create new themes extending one rather theme_gray() theme_bw(), themes define elements deep hierarchy.

title: Foundation Theme — theme_foundation
Foundation Theme — theme_foundation
text: base_size base font size, given pts. base_family base font family

title: Foundation Theme — theme_foundation
text: theme takes theme_gray() sets colour fill values NULL, except top-level elements (line, rect, title), colour = "black", fill = "white". leaves spacing -non colour defaults default ggplot2 themes place.

title: Foundation Theme — theme_foundation
text: https://github.com/jrnold/ggthemes/

title: Value of an ABS Time Series indicator for a specific year and month. — value_at
text: data dataframe ABS time series data. filter_with named list least indicator filter dataframe . at_year year (numeric). Defaults recent year NULL (default) at_month = NULL. at_year specified, value averaged year (yet implemented) at_month month (name). Defaults recent month NULL (default)

text: number

title: Value of an ABS Time Series indicator for a specific year and month. — value_at
code: library(reportabs) labour_force_briefing <- read_absdata("labour_force_briefing") #> Reading labour_force_briefing file found in /tmp/RtmpvDV5w1 value_at(labour_force_briefing , filter_with = list(indicator = "Employed total")) #> → No year or month specified. Returning data for 2025 March #> numeric(0)
